SEARCH
Package librarySE.core

Class CD

java.lang.Object
librarySE.core.AbstractLibraryItem
librarySE.core.CD
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Borrowable, LibraryItem, Searchable
public class CD extends AbstractLibraryItem
Represents a compact audio disc (CD) in the library collection.

A CD is a LibraryItem that carries basic metadata (title and artist) plus a monetary price. The core behaviors for:

  • Price validation and storage
  • Thread-safe borrowing and returning
  • Tracking total vs. available copies
are implemented in the shared abstract base classes (e.g. AbstractLibraryItem / AbstractCopyTrackedItem), so this class focuses mainly on CD-specific fields and search behavior.

Key Features

  • Encapsulates CD metadata (title, artist, price).
  • Supports keyword-based searching on both title and artist.
  • Validates textual input using ValidationUtils.
  • Uses configurable default pricing via Config when no explicit positive price is provided.

Copy Management

The constructor accepts a totalCopies value that determines how many physical copies of the CD exist in the library. The underlying abstract base class maintains the total and available copy counts and exposes them through AbstractLibraryItem.getTotalCopies() and AbstractLibraryItem.getAvailableCopies(), which are also used in toString().

Example Usage


 CD cd = new CD("Greatest Hits", "Queen", BigDecimal.valueOf(39.99));
 System.out.println(cd);
 // [CD] Greatest Hits by Queen (Price:39.99, Available:1/1) â€” Available
Author:
Malak

      artist - CD artist
      price - explicit price or null/non-positive to use defaults

    • matchesKeyword

      public boolean matchesKeyword(String keyword)
      Checks whether the given keyword appears in either the title or artist, case-insensitively. Used by search features.
      Parameters:
      keyword - non-null, non-empty search term
      Returns:
      true if the keyword is contained in title or artist
